CatDescriptText: David Drafts, stock boy, Burrows Street and Mansfield Walker, laborer, Homewood were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 24, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you believe there should be another Negro judge in the local state courts - Allegheny County Court and the Common Pleas Court of Allegheny County?"  Mr. Drafts' answer reads: "Yes, I do.  And the reason is because of the number of Negro voters.  I figure that we should have at least one more."  Mr. Walker's answer reads: "Yes, and the reason is because we don't have enough.  We should have at least two more judges."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of David Drafts wearing eyeglasses, hat, and necktie with floral and stripe pattern, standing in front of street with buildings; Portrait of Mansfield Walker wearing striped necktie, and hat, standing in front of street with buildings
